lines.text: Let's go up to my apartment. It's only a few ruins away from here.

We've all become animals with exactly one instinct left. Self-preservation. Now take me, Miss Frost. Bombed out a dozen times, everything caved in and pulled out from under me. My country, my possessions, my beliefs... yet somehow I kept going. Months and months in air raid shelters, crammed in with five thousand other people. I kept going. What do you think it was like to be a woman in this town when the Russians first swept in? I kept going.
How is good old Iowa?
Sixty-two percent Republican, thank you.
So you fly off back home. Wash your hands. Why, surely. You've got so much soap in the United States.
If you give a hungry man a loaf of bread, that's democracy, if you leave the wrapper on, that's imperialism.

[singing]
Want to buy some illusions? Slightly used, just like new. Such romantic illusions, and they're all about you. I sell them all for a penny, they make pretty souvenirs. Take my lovely illusions, some for laughs, some for tears.
How do you know so much about women's clothing?
My mother wears women's clothing.
Morale! Maybe someday we can send a little committee of our own investigating morale in Washington D.C.
There. Now we're getting someplace. I wonder what holds up that dress...
Must be that German willpower.
Really, Colonel Plummer... you should have your brakes relined!
[as she leaves, he scratches his nose with the middle finger, apparently flipping her off. it WAS Billy Wilder, after all]
Want to buy an illusion?
Don't tell me it's subversive to kiss a Republican!
We'll go there right now!
Where?
To the files!
In the middle of the night? Shouldn't we get permission?
Did we get permission to land in Normandie? Let's go!
